newsitem.title: BURUNDI: Burundi denies it has armed Zaire's Tutsis.
newsitem.headline: Burundi denies it has armed Zaire's Tutsis.

text.p: Burundi's foreign minister denied on Wednesday that his country was arming Banyamulenge ethnic Tutsis battling Zairean soldiers in eastern Zaire in a conflict that has sparked a mass exodus of refugees.
Foreign Minister Luc Rukingama told Reuters that Burundi, itself at war between the Tutsi-dominated army and Hutu rebels, had no interest in attacking its giant neighbour.
"Burundi has no interest in attacking Zaire. We have enough problems within our country," Rukingama said.

He was responding to accusations by Zaire that the Tutsi-dominated armies of Burundi and Rwanda were supporting the Banyamulenge -- an ethnic Tutsi group which came to Zaire from Rwanda at the end of the 18th century.
"We are asking our neighbour Zaire to leave emotions out of this debate which risks adding to the tensions that already exist between the three countries," he said.

Diplomats and aid workers say there is little evidence that Burundi has provided substantial aid to Zaire's Tutsi rebels, but they say individual Burundian soldiers and militia have launched cross-border raids.
More than 200,000 Rwandan and Burundian refugees fled camps north of Uvira at the weekend because of fighting between Zairean troops and Banyamulenge rebels.
